First import NumPy and Matplotlib:

{% raw %} 
%pylab inline

Welcome to pylab, a matplotlib-based Python environment [backend: module://ipykernel.pylab.backend_inline].
For more information, type 'help(pylab)'.
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
import numpy as np
{% endraw %}

Now we show some very basic examples of how they can be used.

{% raw %} 
a = np.random.uniform(size=(100,100))
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
a.shape

(100, 100)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
evs = np.linalg.eigvals(a)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
evs.shape

(100,)
{% endraw %}

Here is a cell that has both text and PNG output:

{% raw %} 
hist(evs.real)

(array([95,  4,  0,  0,  0,  0,  0,  0,  0,  1]),

        39.42458533,  44.71961607,  50.01464682]),

{% endraw %}
